Message.Text: Hey Frank, I just found out my students are sharing code on Snapchat. It makes me worry they’re not taking it seriously.
Actually, Tommy, they’re using Discord for that.
Oh, I thought it was Snapchat. I guess they prefer something so casual for their coding.
No, it’s really Discord. They have channels set up for their discussions.
Still, using Snapchat feels so trivial for something as important as coding.
But it’s not Snapchat; they’re on Discord, where they can really focus.
I just can’t shake the feeling that if they’re on Snapchat, they’re not really engaging with the material.
I understand your concern, but I promise they’re using Discord effectively.
It’s just disappointing to think they might be treating it all so lightly.
